abstract: The premiere of the fourth season of “Lost” delivered 16.1 million viewers on Thursday, Nielsen estimated, lifting ABC to a No. 1 finish on the night, though the audience was down from the 18.8 million who watched last season’s debut. The premiere followed an 8 p.m. show summarizing the series’s complicated back story (13.1 million).
lead_paragraph: The premiere of the fourth season of “Lost” delivered 16.1 million viewers on Thursday, Nielsen estimated, lifting ABC to a No. 1 finish on the night, though the audience was down from the 18.8 million who watched last season’s debut. The premiere followed an 8 p.m. show summarizing the series’s complicated back story (13.1 million).
